intro: Notopleura guadalupensis subsp. tetrapyrena, commonly known as the Guadalupensis tetrapyrena, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
